I am a newbie using JUnit 4.

I try to test a method, method_1(), that is d=
efined to throw two
exceptions (well, one at a time), e.g. Exception_A and =
Exception_B.
Thus, my test method looks like:

---start---
@Test (expected =
=3D Exception_A.class)
public void testMethod() throws Exception_A, Excepti=
on_B {
  try {
    method_1();
  }
  catch (Exception_A e) { throw e; }
  c=
atch (Exception_B e) { throw e; }
}
---end---

Is this currently the way to=
 achieve this? Is there a better way?

Do we need to have the same number o=
f catch blocks for each test
method? If I want expect the test method to th=
row an Exception_B
exception, then I would copy the method above and change=
 the
'expected' to Exception_B.class?


Buhi
